text.p: Villeurbanne, led by American Delaney Rudd, shocked Pau-Orthez 97-95 in a thrilling all-French opener to the second phase of the men's basketball EuroLeague on Wednesday.
Rudd was the undisputed hero, scoring 27 points, including a three-point shot with one minute left as Villeurbanne were trailing their hosts by three points at 95-92.

On the counter-attack, Pau's star skipper Antoine Rigaudeau, back in action after an elbow injury, missed an easy chance, allowing Rudd to make a decisive pass to Jim Bilba, who smashed in the winner with five seconds left in the match.
The loss was all the more unwelcome for Pau as it was their fourth in succession in the competition.
Villeurbanne, on the other hand, maintained their unexpectedly high profile in group G after scoring huge upsets in the first phase against holders Panathinaikos and Barcelona.
The team from the suburbs of Lyon struggled at first, twice trailing by 15 points, but Pau-Orthez were hampered by the poor form of Rigaudeau, who had to wait for 38 minutes to score.
It was much too late as Villeurbanne, far more mobile than their opponents in the second half, had levelled at 85-85 with four minutes left.
